us.phonetic: /ˈkɑmpərəbəl/, (kom′pər ə bəl or, sometimes, kəm pâr′-)

example.eg: If I don't get a comparable offer on the car, you can have it.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 相等的, 比得上的, 可媲美的

example.eg: Seed companies often send comparable substitutes.
In no way is your life comparable to mine.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 可与...相比的, 可与...比较的

example.eg: The job offer from the factory was not comparable to the one I received from the software company.

us.phonetic: /ˈkɑmpərəbəl/, (kom′pər ə bəl or, sometimes, kəm pâr′-)

dsense.name: not comparable to [sth], not comparable with [sth]

example.eg: Art is not comparable to Literature.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不能相提并论的, 与…完全不同的

example.eg: His talent is not comparable to anyone else's.
